text: some marathon Watchers experience an
optical illusion called the waterfall
effect want to see if it happens for you
this is a test okay focus on the dot in
the center of the screen at the end of
this video there's a still photograph if
it appears to be moving slightly you are
experiencing the waterfall effect keep
watching blink if you have to but really
focus on that dot what's happening in
your brain right now is that motion
neurons are sensing the runners moving
from left to right across the screen and
those left to right motion neurons are
getting tired the effect of the end can
be subtle so try not to blink after this
point keep staring at that dot does it
seem like that still photograph is
moving the reason this happens is
because when the motion stops or in real
life like when you look away from the
runners and focus on the sidewalk your
left-to-right neurons are tired and so
the neurons responsible for the opposite
direction are more active when we tested
this video in the office some people
didn't feel it as much as other but it
is a real thing and it might explain why
some fans feel Billy on marathon day but
it's probably nothing like the way most
runners feel
